result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Ruid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be terminated after 9 months with Agent's recommendations.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Comply with random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J Ruid

Treatment letter dated April 21, 2016 filed in Court.
Sentencing hearing on May 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley J Ruid in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Attorney Powers requests the Court schedule a separate sentencing date to allow time for him to obtain documentation showing completion of treatment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court.   Defendant Bradley J Ruid did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
